tournament.name: Duel Commander Mensal - 14/05 - Academia de Jogos

decks.notes: Utilizing land recursion and ramping strategies, this deck aims to quickly establish a dominant board presence with powerful creatures and overwhelm opponents with aggressive plays. By utilizing the commander Titania, Protector of Argoth's ability to capitalize on sacrificing lands, the deck can generate a substantial amount of elemental tokens to pressure opponents and close out games swiftly. With a focus on acceleration and consistency through mana dorks, land tutors, and disruptive spells, the deck aims to create a proactive game plan that puts pressure on opponents from the early turns and maintains control throughout the match.

The deck focuses on leveraging a variety of control tools and creatures to disrupt the opponent's game plan while advancing its own. Through a combination of counterspells, removal, and card selection, it aims to protect its key pieces while slowing down the opponent's strategy. The inclusion of cards like Splinter Twin and Kiki-Jiki, Mirror Breaker provides combo finishers, while cards like Fauna Shaman and Birthing Pod allow for tutoring and toolbox options. The deck also takes advantage of mana acceleration from cards like Utopia Sprawl and Birds of Paradise to ramp into its threats efficiently. Overall, the deck aims to control the board and outvalue the opponent to secure victory.

The main focus of this deck is to efficiently combo off using Animar, Soul of Elements as the commander. The deck contains a variety of creatures and spells that can generate mana, draw cards, and tutor for key pieces of the combo. By utilizing cards like Aluren and Birthing Pod, the deck can quickly assemble a powerful board state and win the game through explosive combos. The mana base is optimized to support the combo pieces and provide the necessary colors of mana to cast spells. Overall, the deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with powerful synergies and interactions to secure a victory in a Duel Commander 1 vs 1 format.

The deck revolves around controlling the game through a combination of board wipes, extra turn spells, and powerful planeswalkers. The goal is to disrupt the opponent's game plan by wiping the board with cards like Upheaval, Jokulhaups, and Devastation while ramping up mana with cards like Cultivate and Kodama's Reach. The commander, Maelstrom Wanderer, provides additional value by cascading into powerful spells for free. The deck also includes a variety of land destruction cards like Wasteland and Dust Bowl to disrupt the opponent's mana base. Overall, the deck aims to control the game until it can establish a dominant board presence through powerful creatures and planeswalkers.

This deck revolves around using aggressive creatures and disruptive spells to control the game and pressure the opponent. By utilizing strong creatures like Jenara, Asura of War and Yisan, the Wanderer Bard, along with mana ramp creatures like Birds of Paradise and Noble Hierarch, the deck aims to establish a strong board presence early on. Disruption spells like Force of Will and Spell Pierce help to protect the board and counter the opponent's threats. Additionally, cards like Sword of Feast and Famine and Sword of Fire and Ice provide extra damage and utility to close out the game quickly. Overall, the deck aims to apply pressure and control the game tempo to secure a victory.

The deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with powerful creatures and spells, utilizing the flexibility of Marath, Will of the Wild as the commander. It includes a mix of aggressive creatures like Inferno Titan and Gideon, Ally of Zendikar, along with board wipes like Wrath of God and cataclysmic effects such as Jokulhaups and Obliterate. The deck also includes powerful planeswalkers like Ugin, the Spirit Dragon and Nissa, Voice of Zendikar to generate value and pressure the opponent. Additionally, the mana base is carefully constructed to support the high cost spells and ramp strategies, with key lands like Tectonic Edge and Mana Confluence to ensure consistent land drops and mana production.

This deck revolves around assembling a powerful combo involving Necrotic Ooze, Phyrexian Devourer, and Triskelion to quickly eliminate opponents. Sidisi, Undead Vizier serves as a versatile commander, able to tutor for combo pieces or disruption as needed. The deck includes a range of tutors and graveyard recursion spells to ensure consistency in finding and utilizing the combo. Additionally, there are various removal spells, card draw engines, and disruption tools to control the game and protect the combo. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's strategy, with a mix of utility lands and efficient ramp sources. Overall, the key strategy is to efficiently assemble and protect the combo while disrupting opponents' game plans.

This deck focuses on controlling the board and disrupting the opponent with a plethora of counterspells and removal spells. It aims to protect its commander, Wydwen, the Biting Gale, while efficiently dealing with threats using a combination of targeted removal and board wipes. The deck also includes card draw and selection tools to ensure consistency and access to key cards. With a variety of control elements and powerful creatures like Baleful Strix, True-Name Nemesis, and Vendilion Clique, this deck seeks to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent, eventually closing out the game with efficient threats like Umezawa's Jitte and powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Liliana of the Veil.
